page.title: 03HOUSING AND POPULATION
page.content: When interviewed, most people had positive{attitudes}for living in this area. "Quite central for travelling"- "Has easy access to a number of larger towns"-"Has a good variety of shops, parks and activities"- "Friendly and helpful people"-"Fairly trouble-free area"-"Country atmosphere"-"A good healthy place to bring up a family". From 1972 to 1982, the{birth rate}fell 25.2%. There has been a marked increase in longevity-40% in the 75+ age group. There is a 42.1% increase in single person{housing}. In this area there is a good mixture of housing - private, local authority, and SSHA. Old buildings have been upgraded or replaced and there are a few modern blocks of flats. There is still a range of{private sector}builders in the area i.e. Barrett,Bellway,Wimpey.
